com.yantra.api.ycp.workflow

Interface changeAvailDateInTaskQueue

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCPApi, YIFApi
    Deprecated. 
    Replaced by manageTaskQueue API as of Sterling Supply Chain Applications 7.9.

    public interface changeAvailDateInTaskQueue

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document changeAvailDateInTaskQueue(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      Deprecated. 
      The changeAvailDateInTaskQueue changes the available date on a task queue request.

    • Method Detail

      • changeAvailDateInTaskQueue

        org.w3c.dom.Document changeAvailDateInTaskQueue(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        The changeAvailDateInTaskQueue changes the available date on a task queue request. This date indicates the probable date after which the task request is likely to be processed successfully. There are various reasons why the processing of the request is deferred, such as:
        • Awaiting arrival of inventory
        • Honoring the delivery date on the order so that the order reaches the customer on the desired date

        Custom agent programs (extensions) can disable the repeated processing of a task request until that date is reached by using the changeAvailDateInTaskQueue API. The custom agent program should calculate the next likely date based on logic that is appropriate for the business scenario, and then set the date on the task queue by calling this API.

        For example, assume that an order is awaiting scheduling. Although a schedule agent should pick the task queue request and start working on it, there would be significant overhead if the schedule agent executes the whole scheduling process at every run, only to determine that there is no inventory for a certain item. Unless the inventory is available, no matter how often the schedule agent runs, this order's task queue request will not be processed successfully. Instead of checking inventory availability at every run, the schedule agent could mark a next available date after the first attempt to schedule the order, based on the inventory availability information in the system. The scheduling agent can then ignore this task queue request in every subsequent run until the available date is reached. This ensures that the task request is processed only when it is most likely to be processed successfully.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        Available date is changed for the task queue request supplied in the input criteria.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        Empty XML Document Object (for future use only).
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
